Description: Body sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black (fired brownish-red); exterior: incised chain of lotuses with added red on kalyxes and palmettes with red on cuffs.
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.555.a, 1888,0601.555.b, 1888,0601.555.d and 1888,0601.555.e. For parallels, see Payne 1931, 154, fig. 62. For examples of the lotus flower and palmette frieze pattern to separate friezes on Corinthian column-kraters, see the Sphortos Painter (Amyx 1988, 508, pl. 120).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.057) (Phase 1)
